FuncDef:
The ignore-hostcar acl command configures host CAR, VLAN-Host-CAR and HTTP-Host-CAR not to apply to packets matching a specified ACL rule.
The undo ignore-hostcar acl command cancels the configuration.
By default, host CAR, VLAN-Host-CAR and HTTP-Host-CAR are not prevented from applying to packets matching an ACL rule.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 3000 to 3999.

Specifies the name of an ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The name must start with a letter or digit, and cannot contain only digits.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When an interface runs routing protocols and you do not want specific protocol packets sent from the interface to the CPU to be limited, run the ignore-hostcar acl command to prevent host CAR, VLAN-Host-CAR and HTTP-Host-CAR from applying to the packets matching a specified ACL rule.
Precautions
This command applies only to the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S/LPUI-51-CM/LPUF-120/LPUF-120-B/LPUF-120-E/LPUI-102-E/LPUI-120/LPUI-120-B/LPUI-120-L/LPUI-52-E/LPUI-120-E/LPUI-120-CM/LPUF-240/LPUF-240-B/LPUF-240-E/LPUI-240/LPUI-240-B/LPUI-240-CM/LPUI-240-L/LPUF-480/LPUF-480-B/LPUI-480/LPUI-480-B/LPUI-480-L/LPUF-480-E/LPUI-480-CM/LPUF-400-E.
When the action of an ACL rule is deny, the packets matching the ACL rule are not discarded and are still sent to the CPU.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
